strings: <se_high>Jessica: The people here are so snobbish and arrogant.
<se_high>Jessica: It's nothing like the church in Alexandria.

<se_low>Yangus: Me 'n' churches just don't go together.
Or me 'n' abbeys.
Or wotever ya wanna call 'em.

<se_low>Yangus: Nah, I'm a pub man meself.
Churches are good for 'avin' a snooze, an' pubs are good for 'avin' some booze! Hah hah!

<se_high>Jessica: It's getting pretty late.
Maybe we should see about finding a room for the night.

<se_high>Jessica: When we first came across the river, I saw something that looked like an inn.
Let's go and check it out.
<se_low>Yangus: Churches usually 'ave a fair bit o' loot.

<se_low>Yangus: Them statues an' candlesticks look awright...
But they must be keepin' the valu'ble stuff 'round back...

<se_low>Yangus: No, Yangus, NO! I, I 'ave washed me 'ands of all that stuff, 'onest, guv!
Honest! You've gotta believe me!
<se_high>Jessica: The Templars certainly seem to think highly of themselves, don't they?

<se_high>Jessica: Who do they think they are, talking to us like that? What a bunch of arrogant idiots.
I can't wait to get out of this place.
<se_low>Yangus: That old gaffer bloke just now came across as the quiet type, but 'e 'ad a glint in 'is eye. I don't reckon 'e misses a trick.
<se_low>Yangus: I'd say 'e keeps a pretty tight guard in this abbey. Dhoulmagus won't be gettin' in wivout a fight.
<se_low>Yangus: So we'll be awright to leave 'ere for now an' start lookin' for a place to spend the night. Eh, guv?
<se_high>Jessica: I don't think we'll find Angelo around here.

<se_high>Jessica: I can never relax until the nasty work's out of the way.
Come on! Let's go and find him!

<se_low>Yangus: All these monks under one roof!
Must cause 'avoc, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: The Abbot geezer must be one 'ell of a bloke!
Maybe 'e'd be up to takin' me confession.
<se_high>Jessica: I hate to say it, but that ring he gave us ended up coming in handy.
<se_high>Jessica: Before we give it back, though, let's go to the monks' quarters and hear what they have to say about Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: All these monks under one roof!
Must cause 'avoc, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: The Abbot geezer must be one 'ell of a bloke!
Maybe 'e'd be up to takin' me confession.
<se_high>Jessica: Does anyone else have the feeling we just heard something we weren't supposed to hear?

<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe those two are brothers.
Anyway, let's get out of here.

<se_low>Yangus: You 'n' that Marcello bloke couldn't be more diff'rent, guv.
Chalk 'n' cheese, you are!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm glad I don't 'ave to answer to 'im, I can tell ya!

<se_high>Jessica: Where do they get off, treating us like that?
Since when did being a traveller rate as a crime?
Ooh, it makes me want to punch something!
<se_high>Jessica: I realise the Abbot is an important man, but there's no need to talk to us like that!
<se_low>Yangus: I can't exactly call meself a gentleman, bein' an ex-thief an' that, but I wouldn't never say nuffin' like that to you.
<se_low>Yangus: I don't care if it's cos 'e 'as to guard old Francisco or wot, I don't like the bloke!

<se_high>Jessica: A jester?
That can only mean one thing.

<se_high>Jessica: He's here.
We're finally going to come face to face with Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: The more I 'ear about all this, the more I'm convinced it's Dhoulmagus!
It's gotta be!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv!
Old Francisco's in danger!

<se_high>Jessica: So that show-off's ring actually came in handy here.
Looks like luck is on our side!

<se_high>Jessica: I don't know what Dhoulmagus is doing over on that island, but it can't be good.
We have to stop him this time!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on! We can get to the island through the ruins in the hills!
<se_low>Yangus: So. Ya can get to the island wivout goin' over the bridge, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: An' we've got the ring wot we need from that kid. All we've gotta do is go to that old ruin or wotever it is, an' see if it works. Come on!
<se_high>Jessica: So the ring turns out to be a key?
<se_high>Jessica: What kind of person just gives away something as important as that?<page>Jessica: That swaggering idiot is going to get a piece of my mind the next time we meet!
<se_low>Yangus: So the abbey weren't always 'ere then?

<se_low>Yangus: Cor, it must've been a bit of a job movin' a whoppin' great buildin' like this, eh!?
I wonder why they bothered.

<se_high>Jessica: Did you hear that?
A jester who walks on water?
Who else could it be!?

<se_high>Jessica: He's here.
We're finally going to come face to face with Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's Dhoulmagus doin' 'ere!?
Wot's 'e up to now!?
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta get over to that island an' warn the Abbot before somefin' terrible 'appens!
<se_high>Jessica: So Dhoulmagus did cross to this continent.

<se_high>Jessica: He won't get away this time.
I'll find him and make him pay for what he did to my brother...

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's Dhoulmagus doin' 'ere!?
Wot's 'e up to now!?
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta get over to that island an' warn the Abbot before somefin' terrible 'appens!
<se_high>Jessica: A jester!? I can't believe it's just a coincidence! If it is Dhoulmagus who's broken into Abbot Francisco's room, we can't let him get away!
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo said that if we follow the river to the left, we can use the ruined abbey to get to the Abbot's residence! Let's go!

<se_low>Yangus: This ain't good, guv!
I'll bet that geezer Angelo was talkin' about Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: He may be a young upstart an' all, but we'd better listen to him this time and get to the ruin sharpish! Along the bank, 'e said...
<se_high>Jessica: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>Jessica: DUMMY LINE
<se_low>Yangus: It brings it all back...

<se_low>Yangus: I dropped a clanger an' got meself caught once, see.
I was in a torture room like this, an'<endash>

<se_low>Yangus: Nah...I can't, guv.
Please, don't ask me to tell ya no more.

<se_high>Jessica: Where do they get off, treating us like that?
Since when did being a traveller rate as a crime?
Ooh, it makes me want to punch something!
<se_high>Jessica: I realise the Abbot is an important man, but there's no need to talk to us like that!
<se_low>Yangus: I can't exactly call meself a gentleman, bein' an ex-thief an' that, but I wouldn't never say nuffin' like that to you.
<se_low>Yangus: I know 'e's gotta guard Abbot Francisco, but still...I don't like the bloke!

<se_high>Jessica: Did you hear that?
A jester who walks on water?
Who else could it be!?

<se_high>Jessica: He's here.
We're finally going to come face to face with Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's Dhoulmagus doin' 'ere!?
Wot's 'e up to now!?
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta get over to that island an' warn the Abbot before somefin' terrible 'appens!

<se_high>Jessica: So that show-off's ring actually came in handy here.
Looks like luck is on our side!

<se_high>Jessica: I don't know what Dhoulmagus is doing over on that island, but it can't be good.
We have to stop him this time!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on! We can get to the island through the ruins in the hills!
<se_low>Yangus: So. Ya can get to the island wivout goin' over the bridge, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: An' we've got the ring wot we need from that kid. All we've gotta do is go to that old ruin or wotever it is, an' see if it works. Come on!
<se_high>Jessica: So the ring turns out to be a key?
<se_high>Jessica: What kind of person just gives away something as important as that?<page>Jessica: That swaggering idiot is going to get a piece of my mind the next time we meet!
<se_low>Yangus: So the abbey weren't always 'ere then?

<se_low>Yangus: Cor, it must've been a bit of a job movin' a whoppin' great buildin' like this, eh!?
I wonder why they bothered.
<se_high>Jessica: That poor soul has been suffering alone all these years...

<se_high>Jessica: It's time to put an end to his pain.
Right, <hero>?

<se_low>Yangus: Huh! I let me guard down back there!
Who'd have thought a monster like that'd get the better of the legend'ry Yangus!?

<se_low>Yangus: We don't 'ave time for this neither!
We've gotta get to the Abbot's room pronto!
<se_high>Jessica: ............!

<se_high>Jessica: So the door's closed?
I should've known some higher power would be guarding the way through!
<se_low>Yangus: There's a bad air 'round 'ere, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: Better watch yer back.
I don't like 'ow this feels.
<se_high>Jessica: I knew it! Dhoulmagus IS here!

<se_high>Jessica: He's inside!
We've got to stop him before he hurts anyone else!

<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus must be inside!
Now we've got 'im!
<se_high>Jessica: It's him. He's here.
<se_high>Jessica: I have you now, Dhoulmagus...

<se_low>Yangus: How on earth did Dhoulmagus get past all these guards on 'is lonesome?
At least it don't look like no one's been killed.

<se_low>Yangus: On guard, guv!
Better be ready for a fight.
<se_high>Jessica: .........

<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe we got frozen like that.
And he was right in front of our eyes.
<se_high>Jessica: I couldn't even move my lips to curse him!
<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't just come to say 'ello, 'as 'e!
<se_low>Yangus: He's after Abbot Francisco now, by the looks of it. ...But why?
<se_high>Jessica: Do you really think this is going to be all right? I don't want to die until I've had my chance to get revenge for Alistair!
<se_low>Yangus: D'ya really think we can trust that kid?
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about all them spikes makes me feel queasy. It's like they're sinkin' into me skin already.
<se_high>Jessica: I've got this weird prickly feeling all over, and I didn't even touch those spikes!

<se_high>Jessica: Let's get out of here.
All I can think about is going after Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: We'll be got by Marcello's 'enchmen again if we 'ang about.
<se_low>Yangus: But we've gotta corner Dhoulmagus an' sort 'im out.
<se_low>Yangus: Awargh! I can't take it!
<se_low>Yangus: I can't think no more! It does me 'ead in!
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus torched the bridge to hold us up while he attacks the Abbot!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him get away with it!
We've got to stop him!
<se_low>Yangus: That kid ain't afraid o' danger, eh, runnin' through the flames like that!

<se_low>Yangus: But it's too risky now, guv.
We betta go 'round through that underground passage.
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus torched the bridge to hold us up while he attacks the Abbot!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him get away with it!
We've got to stop him!
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno if these monks are gonna be able to put the fire out. I ain't too sure they're up to it, meself.

<se_low>Yangus: An' Dhoulmagus!
Wot's 'e tryin' to do!?
The bloke's a serial nutter!

<se_low>Yangus: But 'is days are numbered!
He's got me narked now!

<se_high>Jessica: You're in there, Dhoulmagus.
I know you're in there.
<se_high>Jessica: This time I'm not letting you get away.
<se_low>Yangus: I just 'ope the Abbot's awright!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv!
We gotta 'urry!
<se_high>Jessica: Someone's been hurt!

<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus did this.
He did it again.
We can't let him get away with it.

<se_low>Yangus: This is bad!
I can smell blood in the air.

<se_low>Yangus: You an' Jessica ain't got much experience o' this kinda thing, guv.
Leave it to me if things get ugly, awright?

<se_high>Jessica: If it means killing that demon...
If it means getting revenge for what he did to my brother...

<se_high>Jessica: I'm happy to join forces with that swaggering show-off of a man.
Anything to help us defeat Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: He can walk on water, fly AND 'e's as tough as coconut!
<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't no ordin'ry beast, eh?
<se_def>Angelo: Those injured knights aren't perhaps up to my standard, but they're certainly not easy marks.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm sorry to keep putting you in danger, but I can't do this on my own.
<se_def>Angelo: Abbot Francisco is like a father to me...and Marcello...

<se_def>Angelo: No, never mind.
But anyway, will you help me?

<se_high>Jessica: He killed another person.
He was right in front of me and there was nothing I could do about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I may be down, but I'll never give up.<page>Jessica: We're going to chase that demon until he's got nowhere left to run. And then we're going to make him pay.
<se_low>Yangus: Thump me one, guv! Come on!
<se_low>Yangus: There I was boastin' to you an' Jessica 'ow I'd take care of 'im, but I was about as much use as a porcelain 'ammer against Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>Yangus: Even old Grandad came along an' did 'is bit!
I can't believe it!
I'm bloomin' USELESS!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought between us, you an' me could 'ave anyone, guv...

<se_low>Yangus: Guess I was bein' too cocky, eh?
Too quick to say we didn't need Jessica.

<se_low>Yangus: It's gonna take all of us if we're gonna beat Dhoulmagus.
Even then, I ain't sure if we can do it.

<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe those two are brothers.
They're nothing alike.<page>Jessica: Apart from the way they annoy me every time they open their mouths.
In that respect they're identical twins.

<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. Might equals right, as they say.
I'm happy to take whatever help we can get.

<se_high>Jessica: With an extra pair of hands, things are starting to look up again!
Let's find Dhoulmagus and cut him down to size.
<se_low>Yangus: I didn't follow all o' wot was said before, but is that kid gonna be comin' along wiv us?

<se_low>Yangus: Just think. Wiv four of us... Yeah!
We might be in wiv a shout against Dhoulmagus wiv four of us!

<se_low>Yangus: Awright! Sweet! Nice! Diamond!
...I'm right fired up now, guv!
Ready for action!
<se_high>Jessica: I don't expect Dhoulmagus will be coming back here.
<se_high>Jessica: If we look at the map, we should be able to figure out where Dhoulmagus is going to show up next.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go and track him down.

<se_low>Yangus: I wanna see wot our new ally can do.
We should put Angelo to the test.
<se_low>Yangus: So 'ow about gettin' into a scrap wiv a few monsters, eh? It'll take our minds off lettin' Dhoulmagus get away, too.
<se_def>Angelo: It was about time I left the abbey, really. Far too many rules and regulations and not enough fun for my liking.
<se_def>Angelo: And besides...I wouldn't mind getting to know the delightful Jessica more intimately too.
<se_high>Jessica: This is where... Where Abbot Francisco....

<se_high>Jessica: Let's go. It's still too fresh in my mind, what happened here.
I don't want to stay any longer.
<se_low>Yangus: I never exchanged two words wiv the bloke, but the Abbot was a decent geezer, if you ask me.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a cryin' shame wot 'appened to 'im.
<se_def>Angelo: Both Marcello and I were brought up here in the abbey. Abbot Francisco was like a father to us.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd be going after his murderer whether I'd been ordered to or not. But...
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library. It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: I hope you aren't planning to ask that Templar jerk about the Moonshadow harp!

<se_high>Jessica: No way. N-O.
The last thing I want is to ask him for help.
Let's get out of here.
<se_high>Jessica: So the big jerk said the harp is in Ascantha. Right?

<se_high>Jessica: That means there's no reason to hang around this stupid place!
Let's go to Ascantha!
<se_low>Yangus: Churches an' that do 'ave some bloomin' good treasure in 'em sometimes.
<se_low>Yangus: You know wot yer doin', don't ya guv!?

<se_low>Yangus: Ascantha ain't far from 'ere.
The Moonshadow 'arp's ours now!
Come on! Get ready for a sprint!
<se_def>Angelo: It's hardly been any time since I left the place, but the abbey already feels very alien to me. Or am I being overly sentimental?

<se_def>Angelo: Never mind.
Let's just ask what we came to ask, and leave.

<se_def>Angelo: Marcello loves to study.
He's memorised every book in the abbey.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Always chewing over the facts, digesting the evidence...
Quite a bookworm, he is.
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.
<se_high>Jessica: What a nasty place. Is this really an abbey? It certainly doesn't feel like one.
<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus came from Farebury to Alexandria to the abbey 'ere, an' then crossed the ocean to the west, right?
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv! Let's get the ship 'eaded west!
<se_def>Angelo: So it seems Marcello has become Abbot while retaining his title of Templar Captain.

<se_def>Angelo: What a busy man he is!
No doubt he couldn't be happier with his promotion, however self-styled it was.
<se_high>Jessica: I absolutely cannot stand the sight of that stupid man!

<se_high>Jessica: But I'll drop it this once.
Because he told us the harp's in Ascantha.
I should be grateful for that.
<se_high>Jessica: That doesn't mean I'll keep quiet if he ever talks down to us again, though!

<se_low>Yangus: Ascantha ain't far from 'ere.
The Moonshadow 'arp's ours now!
Come on! Get ready for a sprint!

<se_def>Angelo: We've got the information we came for.
There's no need to hang around here any longer.

<se_high>Jessica: What IS his problem?
After we go to the effort to keep him informed, he treats us like that?

<se_high>Jessica: Who does he think he is?
Everything about that idiot upsets me.
If I never saw him again, it'd be too soon!
<se_low>Yangus: I still don't like that bloke, but wot 'e said's right.
<se_low>Yangus: Findin' that ship an' the Moonshadow 'arp's all part o' the same game at the end o' the day: gettin' Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: I need to fix that prop'ly into me 'ead, or else I'm gonna forget wot we're tryin' to do.

<se_def>Angelo: I've left the abbey now.
I no longer have a duty to report my movements to my seniors.<page>Angelo: In fact, they're not even my seniors any more, are they!?

<se_def>Angelo: So let's go!
To Trodain, I believe?
<se_low>Yangus: It's a shame Grandad and that Charmless bloke can't see eye to eye.

<se_low>Yangus: I actually feel a bit sorry for the old codger.
Bet you never thought you'd see the day!
<se_high>Jessica: I set off on this journey to avenge my brother's death, and yet here I am babysitting this creep!

<se_def>Angelo: Poor Princess Medea.
Even if she's freed from this curse, she has to marry that awful Charmless.
<se_high>Jessica: If I were the Princess, I'd rather stay as a horse than marry that guy!
<se_low>Yangus: I've got it! We should find the Princess a nice 'orse-faced bloke wiv goofy teeth an' a long nose! It's the perfect solution!

<se_def>Angelo: How is that perfect!?
A horse can't marry a human, you idiot!
<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's good to get away from Charmless for a while.

<se_def>Angelo: He's always lording it over us!
How's a man supposed to relax in these conditions!?
<se_low>Yangus: Well that was a bleedin' nightmare! Who'd 'ave thought that 'angin' out wiv royals would be this much of a pain!?
<se_high>Jessica: Once we've got the magic mirror from Argonia, we can finally get back to concentrating on Dhoulmagus again.

<se_def>Angelo: What a prize ass that Charmless is, getting on Medea's back like that!
Imagine if he knew she was his fiancée!
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it's fair enough that he doesn't realise, though. A man doesn't expect his future bride to turn up in a bridle!
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' after that Charmless was a right 'eadache. I almost forgot why we was doin' it for a while.
<se_low>Yangus: But we've got that magic mirror now, so we can finally get through to Dhoulmagus in the Dark Ruins.
<se_high>Jessica: We've had to take a few detours, but finally we can concentrate on Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: It's good that we managed to get the royal treasure at last, but the things that scholar was saying are a bit worrying.

<se_def>Angelo: All that talk about there being no magic in the mirror any more...
It doesn't look promising.
<se_def>Angelo: When you travel around so much like this, you end up with too many choices.
<se_high>Jessica: And what's that supposed to mean?
<se_def>Angelo: I mean it'll be hard to decide where to live once we've taken care of Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: You should all probably start thinking about what you're going to do once it's over too.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I've already got that sorted!
I'm gonna stick with the guv 'ere for good!
<se_high>Jessica: You really LOVE the GUV, huh!?
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' after that Charmless was a right 'eadache. I almost forgot why we was doin' it for a while.
<se_low>Yangus: But we've got that magic mirror now, so we can finally get through to Dhoulmagus in the Dark Ruins.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a good job there's a way of gettin' magic back into the mirror, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Otherwise that prob'ly would've been the end of our journey.
<se_high>Jessica: We've had to take a few detours, but finally we can concentrate on Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: What a nuisance that there's only one spell that can restore the magic to the mirror!
<se_high>Jessica: Think how much easier it would be if one of my spells worked on it!
<se_def>Angelo: When you travel around so much like this, you end up with too many choices.
<se_high>Jessica: And what's that supposed to mean?
<se_def>Angelo: I mean it'll be hard to decide where to live once we've taken care of Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: You should all probably start thinking about what you're going to do once it's over too.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I've already got that sorted!
I'm gonna stick with the guv 'ere for good!
<se_high>Jessica: You really LOVE the GUV, huh!?
<se_def>Angelo: It's good that we managed to get the royal treasure at last, but the things that scholar was saying are a bit worrying.

<se_def>Angelo: All that talk about there being no magic in the mirror any more...
It doesn't look promising.
<se_def>Angelo: How bizarre that the only thing that can return magic to the mirror is some kind of sea monster.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah. But at least ya know where you is wiv a monster, eh?
Not like babysittin' princes an' the like.
<se_high>Jessica: Who knows!?
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe this monster will be really ill and at death's door...

<se_high>Jessica: And let me guess! It'll tell us we have to fetch the medicine to cure it before it casts the spell for us...<page>Jessica: But the medicine's ingredients are locked away in a dungeon guarded by a dragon, or something... And what are we going to do then?
<se_def>Angelo: Has anyone ever told you that you worry too much?
<se_def>Angelo: All we have to do is use the mirror to absorb a spell and then its magic will be restored.

<se_def>Angelo: I suppose not just any old spell will do?
Of course it couldn't possibly be that simple.

<se_low>Yangus: Let's get this out of the way sharpish, eh.
We don't 'ave time to faff about.
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't goin' 'ome 'til we've given Dhoulmagus the wot-for in the Dark Ruins, so we'll just 'ave to do wot it takes to get at 'im.
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo, are you going to leave the Templars when we've defeated Dhoulmagus?

<se_def>Angelo: That's the plan.
I don't want to be around my brother any more for one thing.
<se_def>Angelo: And the Abbot was my only real friend at the abbey. Once I've avenged his death, I won't have any more ties with the place.

<se_low>Yangus: Why d'you 'ate your brother so much, eh?
You've only got the one, after all.
Shouldn't you 'ave a bash at gettin' on?

<se_def>Angelo: It's him who hates me.
I don't have any feelings for him at all...
None whatsoever.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's hurry up back to the Dark Ruins.
Hopefully that mirror we spent so much effort getting hold of will take us to Dhoulmagus at last.
<se_def>Angelo: When we got the magic mirror in Argonia, I thought we were just a breath away from defeating Dhoulmagus.

<se_def>Angelo: But this should be the end of the distractions.
Now it's time to finish him off once and for all!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm well pleased that I could take you an' the old codger to Pickham on our travels!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't get why Angelo didn't take to the place.
Such a pity! Ha ha ha!
<se_high>Jessica: If Alistair lost to this guy, we should be ready for a tough fight!
<se_high>Jessica: We should make sure we're properly prepared before we go back to the Dark Ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: Jessica's a bit strange when you think about it. She's supposed to be a lady and yet here she is, hunting down her brother's killer!
<se_low>Yangus: She may be a lady by name, but she's from the sticks, ain't she? Just the same as the local yokels at the end o' the day!
<se_low>Yangus: Te he he he hee!

<se_high>Jessica: You've got a cheek talking about me like that!
And what's with the weird laugh anyway!?
<se_def>Angelo: I have to avenge the Abbot's death before I can properly draw a line under my life at the abbey.

<se_def>Angelo: When I first set off, I was under orders and nothing more.
But now I feel like this is my own duty.
<se_low>Yangus: D'you think Jessica went off because she don't like us, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Yeah? You reckon that could be it, eh? Maybe I said summat to upset 'er. I mean, untension'bly, like.
<se_low>Yangus: In that case, we've gotta find 'er again so's I can say sorry.
<se_low>Yangus: Hey, 'ere's a thought... Maybe she got caught up in somefin' weird and got kidnapped!?
<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I dunno! Listen to me goin' on! I'm well confused!
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it's a bit strange not having Jessica around. I'd almost go so far as to say I miss her. A bit.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, you're not the only one.
She's a brave one, that Jess.<page>Yangus: You can see it in 'ow she puffs 'er chest out, all proud, when she fights.
<se_def>Angelo: Oh, is that what that is? The first time I met her, I thought she must be hiding some water balloons in there.<page>Angelo: I feared for the dryness of my uniform, I can tell you!
<se_def>Angelo: We should ask after Jessica in Argonia rather than just wandering around aimlessly.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's ask first and look later.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's all the racket about!?
An'<endash> Phwoar! It smells like a brewery in 'ere!
<se_low>Yangus: I didn't think the Goddess approved o' drinkin' to excess, and these are the bleedin' clergy!<page>Yangus:If this is 'ow they're carryin' on, it really will be the end o' the world!
<se_high>Jessica: Sometimes I think about what poetic justice it would be to defeat Rhapthorne here, in the same place we first met Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: It's just a what-if sort of thing. Thoughts like that go through my mind whenever I lie awake, thinking about all the people he's killed.
<se_def>Angelo: Any trace of Marcello's scheming must've been lost in all the confusion.

<se_def>Angelo: Everyone in the abbey just blindly believes in the man, do they?
...Ignorance is bliss!
<se_high>Jessica: I was planning on giving that silly man his ring back along with a piece of my mind! But I suppose I'll let him off just this once.
<se_high>Jessica: That's not important compared to finding a lead on Dhoulmagus. Why don't we ask the people at the abbey if they have any ideas?
<se_low>Yangus: I thought it would be all peaceful at an abbey, like, wot wiv 'em all bein' monks. Looks like it ain't quite that simple, though, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, maybe the big boss 'ere will know somefin' about Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' see wot this Abbot Francisco fella 'as to say for 'imself!
<se_high>Jessica: I have absolutely no interest in doing that guy any favours, but the ‘jester’ has to be Dhoulmagus.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's use the ruins to get to the Abbot's residence.
Then we can check it out for ourselves!

<se_low>Yangus: This ain't good, guv!
I'll bet that geezer Angelo was talkin' about Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: He may be a young upstart an' all, but we'd better listen to him this time and get to the ruin sharpish! Along the bank, 'e said...
<se_high>Jessica: We can use that ring Angelo gave us to get into the ruined abbey. And we can use the ruined abbey to get to the Abbot's residence.

<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry.
The Abbot's guards won't be able to hold Dhoulmagus back for long!

<se_high>Jessica: I don't want to see anyone else get hurt.
Please, do this for me.
Take us to the ruined abbey!
<se_low>Yangus: That Angelo seemed a bit diff'rent to when we met 'im in Simpleton at The Cock 'n' Bull.
<se_low>Yangus: He must've really cared about old Francisco, I s'pose.

<se_high>Jessica: So that swaggering cad's getting a dressing down?
Well, he certainly earned it!
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe it's just me, but I think it'd be rather satisfying to watch him getting yelled at!

<se_low>Yangus: That Marcello's a nasty customer.
An' full of 'imself, too.
<se_low>Yangus: But still...I never thought we'd find a torture chamber underneath a quiet abbey like this!
<se_high>Jessica: Can you hear those voices coming from that room?

<se_high>Jessica: That's got to be Angelo getting yelled at.
Could be fun to watch. Come on!
<se_low>Yangus: Urrrgh! A lock-up, an interrogation room an' a torture chamber to boot!<page>Yangus: Crikey, it's enough to send shivers down yer spine just talkin' about it all!
<se_low>Yangus: Let's give the ring back to that Angelo kid, and get out o' this place quick!

<se_high>Jessica: Marcello?
Oh, that arrogant jerk from the second floor?
Why do we need his permission for anything?

<se_high>Jessica: Well, I suppose it can't be helped.
He was down in the dungeon.
Let's go and get his okay to meet the Abbot.

<se_low>Yangus: A jester crossin' over the bridge...
Even I know wot that means!

<se_high>Jessica: A jester?
That can only mean one thing.

<se_low>Yangus: The more I 'ear about all this, the more I'm convinced it's Dhoulmagus!
It's gotta be!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv!
Old Francisco's in danger!
<se_high>Jessica: This is where... Where Abbot Francisco....

<se_high>Jessica: Let's go. It's still too fresh in my mind, what happened here.
I don't want to stay any longer.
<se_low>Yangus: I never exchanged two words wiv the bloke, but the Abbot was a decent geezer, if you ask me.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a cryin' shame wot 'appened to 'im.
<se_def>Angelo: Both Marcello and I were brought up here in the abbey. Abbot Francisco was like a father to us.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd be going after his murderer whether I'd been ordered to or not. But...
<se_low>Yangus: They'll never notice us lot snoopin' about, wiv all that racket they're makin'.
<se_low>Yangus: It's 'andy for us, but I bet they'll regret it in the mornin', eh?
<se_high>Jessica: The heirs of the great sages were located all over the world. As if they were placed deliberately, to protect the whole of mankind...
<se_high>Jessica: Do you think the sages will be happy to see each other again? I mean, when we bring together all of the orbs?
<se_def>Angelo: We hardly need to kill time, you know. You should use the flute.
<se_def>Angelo: There's no sense in being here if there are no orbs. No one's here any more.
<se_low>Yangus: Crikey! The echo works even in a little room like this! ...Right then, where's that orb?
<se_high>Jessica: I know we have to hurry, but finding this orb so easily makes me nervous.
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, every orb we find represents another step towards our final confrontation with Rhapthorne.
<se_def>Angelo: .........Poor Abbot Francisco. Finding the orb here is like finding proof of his death.
<se_def>Angelo: I know it sounds stupid, but... Part of me sort of hoped he might somehow still be alive.
<se_def>Angelo: I must sound like a complete fool.

<se_high>Red: The Templars ain't 'eard about Marcello yet, eh?
Prob'ly better for them that they don't know.

<se_high>Red: Anyway, it'll get back to 'em soon enough.
Even if we don't spill the beans, they'll find out before long.

<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, these Templars are nothing-for-good slobs! Look at all the messes! Their mammas
and papas have not brong them up in the
right way, ay?
